metadata.title: CVE-2020-8619 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In ISC BIND9 versions BIND 9.11.14 -> 9.11.19, BIND 9.14.9 -> 9.14.12, BIND9.16.0 -> 9.16.3, BIND Supported Preview Edition 9.11.14-S1 -> 9.11.19-S1:Unless a nameserver is providing authoritative service for one or morezones and at least one zone contains an empty non-terminal entry containingan asterisk ("*") character, this defect cannot be encountered. A would-beattacker who is allowed to change zone content could theoreticallyintroduce such a record in order to exploit this condition to cause denialof service, though we consider the use of this vector unlikely because anysuch attack would require a significant privilege level and be easilytraceable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.12').
